english: Today was our VSMR quarterly wrap-up meeting.
korean: 오늘은 VSMR 분기 총괄회의가 있는 날이었어요.

english: It was actually the last one of the year.
When I got to the conference room, a lot of people were already there.
korean: 회의장에 도착했을 때 이미 많은 사람들이 와 있었어요.

english: Everyone was busy getting ready for their presentations.
I ran into a few people I hadn’t seen in a while, so we said hi and chatted for a bit.
korean: 오랜만에 만난 사람들도 있어서 잠깐 인사하고 얘기도 나눴고요.

english: Honestly, the first thing that really caught my eye was the coffee booth.
korean: 솔직히 제일 먼저 눈에 들어온 건 커피 부스였어요.

english: I grabbed a cup of coffee, and that really helped me settle down.
korean: 커피 한 잔을 마셨는데, 그게 마음을 가라앉히는 데 도움이 됐어요.

english: The meeting itself was pretty full.
Around a hundred professors, students, and researchers were there.
Everyone shared updates on their work, and there were lots of questions.
korean: 각자 맡은 과제 진행 상황을 발표하고 질문도 많이 나왔어요.

english: Our team leader explained our progress really clearly.
korean: 우리 팀은 팀장님이 진행 상황을 아주 잘 설명해 주셨어요.

english: What stood out to me was how many papers people have been submitting.
korean: 인상 깊었던 건 생각보다 논문 제출이 정말 많았다는 거예요.

english: It really felt like everyone has been working hard in their own role.
korean: 다들 각자 자리에서 열심히 하고 있구나 하는 느낌이 들었어요.

english: It gave me a lot of ideas to take notes on.
korean: 그래서 저도 떠오른 아이디어들을 메모해 두었어요.
